t: Proverbs 24
Do*pn not be envious of evil men, Nor*ld desire to be with them;
For*ld their heart devises violence, And*ld their lips talk of troublemaking.
Through*ln wisdom a house is built, And*ld by understanding it is established;
By*ld knowledge the rooms are filled With*ld all precious and pleasant riches.
A*ln wise man is*i strong, Yes,*ld a man of knowledge increases strength;
For*ld by wise counsel you will wage your own war, And*ld in a multitude of counselors there*i is*i safety.
Wisdom*ln is*i too lofty for a fool; He*ld does not open his mouth in the gate.
He*ln who plots to do evil Will*ld be called a schemer.
The*ld devising of foolishness is*i sin, And*ld the scoffer is*i an abomination to men.
If*iln you faint in the day of adversity, Your*ld strength is*i small.
Deliver*ln those*i who*i are drawn toward death, And*ld hold back those*i stumbling to the slaughter.

If*ld you say, “Surely we did not know this,” Does*ld not He who weighs the hearts consider it?*i He*ld who keeps your soul, does He not*i know it?*i And*ld will He not*i render to each*i man according to his deeds?
My*ln son, eat honey because it*i is*i good, And*ld the honeycomb which*i is*i sweet to your taste;
So*ld shall*i the knowledge of wisdom be*i to your soul; If*ld you have found it,*i there is a prospect, And*ld your hope will not be cut off.
Do*ln not lie in wait, O wicked man,*i against the dwelling of the righteous; Do*ld not plunder his resting place;
For*ld a righteous man*i may fall seven times And*ld rise again, But*ld the wicked shall fall by calamity.
Do*ln not rejoice when your enemy falls, And*ld do not let your heart be glad when he stumbles;
Lest*ld the Lord*s see it,*i and it displease Him, And*ld He turn away His wrath from him.
Do*ld not fret because of evildoers, Nor*ld be envious of the wicked;
For*ld there will be no prospect for the evil man;*i The*ld lamp of the wicked will be put out.
My*ln son, fear the Lord*s and the king; Do*ld not associate with those given to change;
For*ld their calamity will rise suddenly, And*ld who knows the ruin those two can bring?
Further Sayings of the Wise
These*p things*i also belong*i to the wise: It*ipn is*i not good to show partiality in judgment.
He*ld who says to the wicked, “You are*i righteous,” Him*ld the people will curse; Nations*ld will abhor him.
But*ld those who rebuke the*i wicked*i will have delight, And*ld a good blessing will come upon them.
He*ln who gives a right answer kisses the lips.
Prepare*ln your outside work, Make*ld it fit for yourself in the field; And*ld afterward build your house.
Do*ln not be a witness against your neighbor without cause, For*ld would you deceive with your lips?
Do*ld not say, “I will do to him just as he has done to me; I*ld will render to the man according to his work.”
I*ln went by the field of the lazy man,*i And*ld by the vineyard of the man devoid of understanding;
And*ld there it was, all overgrown with thorns; Its*ld surface was covered with nettles; Its*ld stone wall was broken down.
When*ld I saw it,*i I considered it*i well; I*ld looked on it*i and*i received instruction:
A*ld little sleep, a little slumber, A*ld little folding of the hands to rest;
So*ld shall your poverty come like*i a prowler, And*ld your need like an armed man.
